articles.headline: Jewish American Families Confront a Generational Divide Over Israel
articles.snippet: Gen Z and young Millennials often see Israel as an occupying power oppressing Palestinians — a shock to their parents and grandparents, who tend to see it as an essential haven fighting for survival.
articles.abstract: Gen Z and young Millennials often see Israel as an occupying power oppressing Palestinians — a shock to their parents and grandparents, who tend to see it as an essential haven fighting for survival.
articles.lead_paragraph: Marc Kornblatt prepared uneasily last month for his daughter, Louisa, to arrive for 10 days with the family. Her homecomings once brought the comfort of movie nights and card games, but this year was different.
articles.byline: By Emma Goldberg and Marc Tracy

articles.headline: Xi Jinping Is Asserting Tighter Control of Finance in China
articles.snippet: The Communist Party’s main theoretical journal has laid out a new ideological framework for the financial system that emphasizes the primacy of China’s top leader and Marxist principles.
articles.abstract: The Communist Party’s main theoretical journal has laid out a new ideological framework for the financial system that emphasizes the primacy of China’s top leader and Marxist principles.
articles.lead_paragraph: In his decade as China’s top leader, Xi Jinping has asserted greater control for himself and the Communist Party over the country’s economy. Now, Mr. Xi has moved to extend that power more forcefully than ever over China’s financial system.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Joy Dong

articles.headline: Tuberville Drops Blockade of Most Military Promotions
articles.snippet: Under pressure from senators in both parties, the Alabama Republican allowed more than 400 promotions to move forward, saying he would continue to block only the most senior positions.
articles.abstract: Under pressure from senators in both parties, the Alabama Republican allowed more than 400 promotions to move forward, saying he would continue to block only the most senior positions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Tommy Tuberville, Republican of Alabama, on Tuesday lifted his blockade of nearly all the military promotions he had delayed for almost a year in protest of a Pentagon policy ensuring abortion access for service members, saying he would continue to hold up only the most senior generals.

articles.headline: Smaller Airlines Seek Mergers to Compete With Industry Giants
articles.snippet: JetBlue Airways is trying to persuade a federal court to let it acquire Spirit Airlines, a deal that the Justice Department says will raise fares and reduce competition.
articles.abstract: JetBlue Airways is trying to persuade a federal court to let it acquire Spirit Airlines, a deal that the Justice Department says will raise fares and reduce competition.
articles.lead_paragraph: Smaller airlines that operate in the shadow of the nation’s four dominant air carriers are increasingly feeling pressure to merge with others to gain access to more planes and airport gates.

articles.headline: Justices Seem Skeptical of Challenge to Trump-Era Tax Provision
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court’s liberal wing and more moderate conservatives seemed to be searching for a way toward a limited ruling on a tax law that affects foreign profits of American companies.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court’s liberal wing and more moderate conservatives seemed to be searching for a way toward a limited ruling on a tax law that affects foreign profits of American companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court seemed open on Tuesday to narrowly upholding a tax on foreign income in a case that many experts had warned could rewrite vast portions of the U.S. tax system.

articles.headline: War Intensifies in Southern Gaza, Where Civilians Say No Place Is Safe
articles.snippet: Amid some of the war’s heaviest bombing, Israeli forces battled Hamas deep into the city of Khan Younis, with few signs that Israel was heeding Biden administration calls to show more restraint.
articles.abstract: Amid some of the war’s heaviest bombing, Israeli forces battled Hamas deep into the city of Khan Younis, with few signs that Israel was heeding Biden administration calls to show more restraint.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israeli soldiers pushed into the heart of the largest city in the southern Gaza Strip on Tuesday, Israel and Hamas said, amid some of the most intense bombing and ground combat of the war, and growing concerns that there is almost nowhere left for desperate civilians to flee.
articles.byline: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg, Ben Hubbard and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: How Nations Are Losing a Global Race to Tackle A.I.’s Harms
articles.snippet: Alarmed by the power of artificial intelligence, Europe, the United States and others are trying to respond — but the technology is evolving more rapidly than their policies.
articles.abstract: Alarmed by the power of artificial intelligence, Europe, the United States and others are trying to respond — but the technology is evolving more rapidly than their policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: When European Union leaders introduced a 125-page draft law to regulate artificial intelligence in April 2021, they hailed it as a global model for handling the technology.
articles.byline: By Adam Satariano and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: Years After Monsanto Deal, Bayer’s Roundup Bills Keep Piling Up
articles.snippet: Juries recently awarded plaintiffs more than $2 billion in damages tied to Roundup, the weedkiller that has been linked to cancer. Bayer is fighting back.
articles.abstract: Juries recently awarded plaintiffs more than $2 billion in damages tied to Roundup, the weedkiller that has been linked to cancer. Bayer is fighting back.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three years after Bayer agreed to pay $10 billion to settle claims that its weedkiller, Roundup, caused cancer, juries continue to award plaintiffs in additional cases billions of dollars in damages, even as the German drug and chemicals giant insists it will continue its fight in court.

articles.headline: Megyn Kelly Returns to the Debate Spotlight, This Time on NewsNation
articles.snippet: Wednesday’s Trump-less debate is a breakthrough moment for a fledgling cable network — and a comeback of sorts for Ms. Kelly, a former Fox News star.
articles.abstract: Wednesday’s Trump-less debate is a breakthrough moment for a fledgling cable network — and a comeback of sorts for Ms. Kelly, a former Fox News star.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eight years ago, Megyn Kelly’s turn as a debate moderator made headlines around the world. Before an audience of 24 million Fox News viewers, she confronted Donald J. Trump about his history of misogynist remarks, setting off a well-publicized feud that helped her leap from cable news to NBC.

articles.headline: Obamas’ Vision for Hollywood Company: ‘This Isn’t Like Masterpiece Theatre’
articles.snippet: With three new films on Netflix, Barack and Michelle Obama’s production company, Higher Ground, is pursuing projects in different genres that aren’t always uplifting.
articles.abstract: With three new films on Netflix, Barack and Michelle Obama’s production company, Higher Ground, is pursuing projects in different genres that aren’t always uplifting.
articles.lead_paragraph: The film “Leave the World Behind” centers on the idea of mistrust and how easy it is for humans to lose empathy for one another when faced with a crisis. It is at once unnerving, misanthropic and bleak, and, perhaps somewhat surprisingly, it’s produced by Barack and Michelle Obama’s production company, Higher Ground.

articles.headline: Google Updates Bard Chatbot With ‘Gemini’ A.I. as It Chases ChatGPT
articles.snippet: After more than eight months of research and development, Google has unveiled its most powerful A.I. so far. But only parts of it are widely available.
articles.abstract: After more than eight months of research and development, Google has unveiled its most powerful A.I. so far. But only parts of it are widely available.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a year, Google has raced to build technology that could match ChatGPT, the eye-opening chatbot offered by the San Francisco artificial intelligence start-up OpenAI.
articles.byline: By Cade Metz and Nico Grant
